intro: Gerascanthus luteus, commonly known as the yellow gerascant, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its stems are upright and branching. Gerascanthus luteus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
